item.description: According to the Press Information Bureau, Astrophysicists in India have spotted a rare merging of three supermassive black holes. They were observing the merging of two galaxies named NGC7733 and NGC7734 in our celestial neighbour. item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi agreed on the rise of Islamic radicalization in the region and are concerned over spread of terrorism by Taliban affiliated groups in Pakistan. item.title: Virtual QUAD meet on 12th August, 2021
item.description: On August 12th, 2021 Senior Officials from four democracies - Australia, India, Japan, and the U.S. - met virtually to discuss Quad initiatives on economic recovery, maritime security, and human rights that promote a free and open IndoPacific region. item.title: GSLV-F10 to launch Earth Observation Satellite
item.description: GSLV-F10 is slated to launch Earth Observation Satellite, EOS-03 on August 12th, 2021 from Satish Dhawan Space Centre SHAR, Sriharikota. Countdown for the launch of GSLV-F10/EOS-03 mission commenced on August 11th at 03:43 Hrs (IST) from Satish Dhawan Space Centre (SDSC) SHAR, Sriharikota GSLV-F10 launch took place today (12th Aug) at 05:43 H
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: July 26th - Kargil Vijay Diwas
item.description: In 1999, India successfully took command of high outposts on this date. The Kargil war was fought for more than 60 days & ended on this date. Pakistani army took advantage of the melting snow & took command of high outposts of India, by betraying the bilateral agreement of both the nations that posts would remain unattended during winter season.
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: July 23rd - National Broadcasting Day
item.description:
During the British Raj, Broadcasting began in June 1923 with the programs by the Bombay Presidency Radio Club and other radio clubs.

item.title: ISRO successfully conducted the Third Test on Vikas Engine for Gaganyaan
item.description: On July 14, 2021, ISRO has successfully conducted the third long-duration hot test of the liquid propellant Vikas Engine for the core L110 liquid stage of the human-rated GSLV MkIII vehicle, as part of the engine qualification requirements for the Gaganyaan Programme. item.title: Heat on Earth’s Atmosphere is Heating much as it did fifteen years ago
item.description: Earth's energy imbalance doubled between 2005 - 2019, this was identified by a team from NASA & NOAA. item.title: Device with Two Atoms thick, World’s thinnest device
item.description: World’s thinnest piece of technology has been developed by the Scientists, which is a device with only two Atoms thick, very tiny. It can be used to store electronic information. item.title: Powerful Solar Storm approaching Earth
item.description: According to website spaceweather.com, a powerful solar storm is approaching the Earth at a speed of 1.6 million kilometers and this storm will hit the Earth someday on 11th July - 13th July 2021. As per the website spaceweather.com, the storm that originated from the Sun's atmosphere can have a significant impact on a region of space dominated by Earth's magnetic field.
